title: HOLD UP...why did FNATIC break up?
body:
I havent kept up with esports since world but after destroying most competition why would FNATIC break up?


Update: so i found and read the statements. And NA just straight up outbid FNATIC. I did not see that coming.

> [{quoted}](name=Avantel,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=ykdRkZOl,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-11T04:15:15.657+0000)
>
> Players wanted to move on and could get better opportunities elsewhere

"money" elsewhere.

Fnatic break up because an org backed by new rich investors coming up from outside e-sports escene offered the highest amount of money ever offered to a player by a Western team for Huni and a fat contract as well to reignOver, and Fnatic decided to not match those really big offers
The reason why yellowStar decided to live is unknown yet, because it wasn't an economic problem for him as Fnatic had matched NA offers
Anyone have an idea about how much players get paid in NA?

Svenskeren was offered 5.5k/ month + 50k signing bonus from H2K (the birth of a meme!), and TSM offered a salary that was a base salary that was higher but in a year wouldn't have covered the difference made by signing bonus, while it would have starting to be bigger if Sven remains for more than 1 year
This means TSM probably offered something in 7-9k/month range to Sven

This is the offer done te Sven, but Immortals and NRG have been reported to offer much more than that to their import stars they grabbed (GMB and Huni at least)...but these organizations are just backed by rich investors coming from outside the e-sports environment

Lower caliber players are paid less, to various degree till the lowest paid one that just got paid the minimum salary given by Riot + teams and are offered housing + food (basically paid expenses) in addition to that
